page.title: 16COUNTRY HSE HOTEL:C WESTON
page.content: Coney Weston Hall stands on an estate recorded in the later Domesday Book.The present house is a fine example of a Country House of the Queen Anne period. There are now 25 acres of grounds,man- aged as gardens & parkland.These con- tain many fine trees of which the wide variety is a particular feature of the estate.A matured Serpentine (or "crinkle-crankle") wall surrounds the kitchen & herb gardens.Mulberries,nec- tarines,peaches & grapes are among the home-grown produce.The formal gardens to the SW contain two small lakes.The Hall is now a licensed Country House Hotel,offering twentieth-century facilities in a period setting. Part of a group of companies specialising in the manufacture & distribution of health foods, the Hotel provides good food for all tastes, with vegetarian meals a speciality.
